title: Filip Petrov
text:
Filip Petrov (<a href="Macedonian%20Language">Macedonian</a>: Филип Пeтpoв, born 23 February 1989) is a <a href="Macedonians%20%28ethnic%20group%29">Macedonian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er currently playing for <a href="FK%20Vardar">Vardar</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Skopje">Skopje</a>, <a href="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a> (today <a href="North%20Macedonia">North Macedonia</a>), he is the son of former footballer <a href="Mirko%20Petrov">Mirko Petrov</a>. While playing with the youth team of Vardar, Filip Petrov was regarded as one of the most talented youth players.
After playing as senior with <a href="FK%20Vardar">FK Vardar</a> since 2007, Filip decided to move abroad and signed with <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> club <a href="FK%20Javor%20Ivanjica">FK Javor Ivanjica</a> in January 2010. After playing one and a half seasons with them, he returned in summer 2011 to his former club, Vardar. At the end of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20First%20Macedonian%20Football%20League">2011–12 First Macedonian Football League</a>, beside winning the championship with Vardar, he became the league's top assistant and on 27 July 2012 he was selected for the <a href="First%20Macedonian%20Football%20League">MPL</a> season best XI by the local football specialised website macedonianfootball.com.
Filip Petrov had played with the <a href="North%20Macedonia%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Macedonian U-17</a> and <a href="North%20Macedonia%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">U-19</a> teams, and since 2009 has been a regular in the <a href="North%20Macedonia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Macedonian U-21</a> team.
Petrov signed with <a href="FK%20Makedonija%20Gjor%C4%8De%20Petrov">FK Makedonija Gjorče Petrov</a> in May 2018. He then joined <a href="FK%20Borec">FK Borec</a> in January 2019.
Achievements.
FK Vardar
FK Pelister
